description: From Middle English hondwerk, from Old English handweorc (“work done by hand; handiwork”), from Proto-Germanic *handuwerką; equivalent to hand +‎ work. Cognate with Dutch handwerk, German Handwerk, Swedish hantverk.

entries.meaning: Work done by the hands, as opposed to by machine.

verbs.description: handwork (third-person singular simple present handworks, present participle handworking, simple past and past participle handworked)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To work (materials) by hand, without the use of a machine.
